meanings.definition: To provide the money for a project or venture.
meanings.sent1: My uncle bankrolled my college education.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy investor bankrolled the construction of the new hospital.
meanings.sent3: I wish a fairy would magically bankroll my dream vacation.
meanings.sent4: Her determination bankrolled her journey to success.
meanings.sent5: The generous donation bankrolled the entire charity event.

meanings.sent1: The bankrolled project was a huge success.
meanings.sent2: She was part of a bankrolled expedition to Antarctica.
meanings.sent3: The bankrolled party was the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The bankrolled team made it to the finals.
meanings.sent5: The bankrolled film had an all-star cast.
